@strucker wrote:

[quote=“Int Bauk, post:12, topic:465188”]everything that i wanted to say has been said.

anyway, just little things like conventions and naming:

if(madefire == true) { madefire = false; fmwalkto(0, -1); }

if(determineFire) { walkPlayer(0, -1); determineFire = false; }

can all build up.[/quote]
ok,ty

item.title: Firemaking
item.dc:creator: @Clawz_fury lare69
item.description:
@Clawz_fury wrote:

[quote=“tyb97, post:3, topic:465188”]This is pretty bad, just saying. Lets go through this.

  1. Don’t use timers. Especially not in a single-threaded application, which I’m assuming this, if not, it’s still not good practice. Every time a player performs this skill, a new thread is started, and may take a while to be garbage collected, which is not good, as these threads can pile up and possibly cause a blow to efficiency. This method just isn’t good practice in servers.[/quote]
    Was just about to mention this but I guess you beat me too it.

&& why would you use the process method for this… it could be done much more efficiently.

Read full topic

item.title: Firemaking
item.dc:creator: @tyb97 tyb97
item.description:
@tyb97 wrote:

[quote=“strucker, post:4, topic:465188”]I know, but i have to learn somewhere, even if its not good after all its better than teh garbage it already has and i will fix number two in a second.
Number three has to be done that way, otherwise it won’t work, i asked lostmyphat why it didn’t work if i would put it in the delaymethod and he said that he had that problem too and had to add in process, i asked randqm too and he said that is a bug all delta servers have.[/quote]
You shouldn’t adjust your methods to cope with the bug, you shall fix the bug, don’t EVER EVER say “it’s still works”, or “it’s still better than before”, do it right or there’s really no point in doing it at all, just being for real.

item.title: Firemaking
item.dc:creator: @tyb97 tyb97
item.description:
@tyb97 wrote:

This is pretty bad, just saying. Lets go through this.

  1. Don’t use timers. Especially not in a single-threaded application, which I’m assuming this, if not, it’s still not good practice. Every time a player performs this skill, a new thread is started, and may take a while to be garbage collected, which is not good, as these threads can pile up and possibly cause a blow to efficiency. This method just isn’t good practice in servers.

  2. if ((itemUsed == 590) && (useWith == logs[h]) && (itemUsed == logs[h]) || (useWith == 590)) {
    This shouldn’t work at all. It’s saying you have to use logs on logs on tinderbox all at the same time. Lol.

  3. if(madefire == true) { madefire = false; fmwalkto(0, -1); }
    No, just no.

south-park:

Looks good but add firemaking.java.

Amazing advice.

Read full topic

item.title: Firemaking
item.dc:creator: @strucker Strucker
item.description:
@strucker wrote:

Hey guys today im posting a snippet i made for delta because its firemaking really sucks.
This includes:
A shorter code than delta’s one.
Working emote.
Walking back when your lit the logs.
This doesn’t include:
Clipping.
event

So lets start, first of all go to your client and if you dont have timer imports add them:

import java.util.Timer;
import java.util.TimerTask;

We’ve just imported timers so we can use timers yay

Now add this method anywhere.

	public void FireDelayedTask() {
                Timer timer = new Timer();
                int delayTime = 7000; // Milliseconds to wait before running delayed task
                timer.schedule(new TimerTask() {
               @Override
               public void run() { 
               makeGlobalObject(absX,absY, 2732, 0, 10); //fire created after 7000m	s				
	       madefire = true;//set our boolean to true.   
               System.out.println("FireDelayedTask Ran by "+playerName+""); //prints to prompt                               
                        }                        
                }, delayTime);
        }

and this too…

public boolean madefire = false;

Now search for

boolean process

We are adding this because delta has a bug and you can’t make it walk back from the packet or delayed method. so add it.

if(madefire == true) {
			madefire = false;
			fmwalkto(0, -1);
			}

We just added the walking back stuff (obviously after finishing emote and fire creation)

now search for packet 53 (case 53) and add this(after the ints):

                        int[] xp = { 100, 200, 200, 300, 400, 42 }; // needed xp
			int[] requiredfm = { 1, 5, 25, 50, 70, 85 }; //required levels
			int[] logs = { 1511, 1513, 1515, 1517, 1519, 1521 }; // id of logs
			
			for (int h = 0; h < logs.length; h++) { // loop so we can use the arrays blabla
			
			            if ((itemUsed == 590) && (useWith == logs[h])) {
					if (playerLevel[11] >= requiredfm[h]) {
					deleteItem(logs[h], getItemSlot(logs[h]), 1);
					addSkillXP(xp[h], 11);
					setAnimation(733);					 
					resetWC();
					FireDelayedTask();				
					} else {							
					}
				}

Thanks, Criticsm will be thanked.

Read full topic
